data.title: Add more options to settings GUI including game-speed slider
data.body:
This adds several new hidden settings to the Red Alert and Dune 2000 settings menu including the anticipated game-speed slider from #2058.

data.title: OS X: very high cpu usage
data.body:
I don't know if this has to do with Mono framework or not, but CPU hits 99% and the audio gets choppy.

Specs:
OpenRA 20121019
Mono Framework 2.10.10
MBP, mid-2009 with OS X 10.8.2

data.title: Wish: one yaml to rule them all
data.body:
Wish:

One reference yaml with all settings. All sounds, showing how to get and remove a building, allow, and disallow a unit, etc..... 

No more need to open all different yaml and mixes, then finding out where to put it..

data.title: fixed a issue with pinging Master-server
data.body:
fixes #2564

Sometimes initial TickCount is less than zero, so (Environment.TickCount - lastPing) can be less than "MasterPingInterval \* 1000". That's why PingMasterServer() is not calling for a long time until somebody connected.

data.title: Survival01 by @NukemBro
data.body:
This is pull request #2657 rebased it onto current bleed. I fixed compiler errors, open areas in the map terrain, and some line-endings in scripts as well as added this to the .csproj for IDEs. Also removed the other maps that were already in or had bad file names with spaces.

TL;DR: minor fixes.

data.title: Don't allow MCV/FACT to be sold
data.body: This is almost always done to exploit the `free mcv` logic in the crates.

data.title: Anti-basewalk balance adjustments
data.body: Making this a pull request because I would like some opinions on these changes and some testing done. They generally make defenses bad against wooden structures which will discourage basewalking and make basewalking more difficult. Because some structures like `fact` and the superweapons are heavy I have moved them over to wood and given them a health boost. pbox and hbox have been moved over to heavy from wood. I have left the pillbox weapons unchanged.

milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Out of sync in frame 9693.

     Subject: "player 3". 
     TargetActor: ""

Situation : i chrono 5x mammoth tank onto the edge of an opponents gap generator. 1 of them fails to deliver (only 4 move) - because it would end up on top of a building. Freeze frame for almost a second and crash. Crashreport as above.

data.title: Graphics: War Factory gate closes b4 Mammoth Tank exits
data.body: Purely a graphics issue. The War factory gate shuts when the Mammoth Tank is about halfway out because of the unit's slow movement.

data.title: option for AI: don't build on ore/tiberium
data.body:
I've noticed AI will sometimes build on tiberium, which seems kinda silly, since it would prevent regrowth in that area. It would be nice if there were an AI option, "DontBuildOnOre" or something. Could be configured in .yaml, within a map.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/102575-option-for-ai-don-t-build-on-ore-tiberium?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Cheats to give opponent things.
data.body:
Feature request:
When I'm testing, I always need to cheat to make things go faster. But I can't cheat for the AI and give him stuff I want him to have. I have to wait, because I am still reliant on the AI to produce something to test my weapons on. It would be great if I could just plop down 5 guard towers in the enemy's base, or give him 20 mammoth tanks, or give him money. That would make my life a lot easier and more  fun while testing.   :)

please & thank you.

data.title: user-configurable hotkey via in-game settings
data.body:
This makes the existing https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Controls user-configurable via in-game settings and adds sell/repair/powerdown hotkey to the RA/D2k mod, too.

![hotkey-config-simple](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/756669/142118/2ece995e-72c3-11e2-9516-3580957c981c.png)

It is a heavily stripped down version of #2501 which was a clean-up of #2000 initially by @TiriliPiitPiit.

data.title: Error msg could be more useful when duplicate keys found in .yaml
data.body:
When I have duplicate keys in a .yaml file, I get this error message:

```
Exception of type `System.ArgumentException`: An item with the same key has already been added.
   at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowArgumentException(ExceptionResource resource)
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.Insert(TKey key, TValue value, Boolean add)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToDictionary[TSource,TKey,TElement](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector, Func`2 elementSelector, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToDictionary[TSource,TKey](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector)
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.MiniYaml.Merge(List`1 a, List`1 b, Boolean throwErrors)
...
```

Sometimes I make two copies of a key when I do editing or pasting. (When I mod/playtest, I make custom .yaml files, and list them in mod.yaml). It can be time-consuming to hunt down where a duplicate is. It would be helpful if the error message referred to the line number where a dupe was found, or the name of the key, or at least the filename.
Thanks,

data.title: stealth tank should decloak after crushing infantry
data.body: In the original C&C, the Stealth Tank would decloak after crushing some infantry. Would be nice to see the behavior replicated. Thanks.

data.title: [cnc] inftry detect cloaked in next tile(C&C orig)
data.body:
Infantry can detect cloaked units in the next tile. This behaviour was in the original C&C Gold.
(Even though it says range=2, it is actually just in the next tile)

Fixed GrenadierExplode.

data.title: [cnc] vehicles - shroud, +small explosions
data.body:
Added small explosion for heavy vehicles. (tanks, MLRS, mcv, harvester)
Increased shroud for Buggy, Bike, LTNK and APC.

data.title: [cnc] added names for explosions
data.body:
Easier-to-understand names for explosions, which can be used in the future. Can phase out old names/numbers slowly.
Also included some explosions from the C&C Content which were not in use and did not have names.

data.title: Add support for Nyergud's Music Upgrade pack
data.body:
This adds support for nyergud's music upgrade pack, which can be downloaded at http://nyerguds.arsaneus-design.com/cnc95upd/cc95p106/

This will help the people who don't have covert ops music, but want it in.

data.title: [cnc] gave names to some explosions
data.body:
Gave names to some explosions, for future use.
Leaving current numbered explosions in place.
More to come.

data.title: Nuke does not harm light tanks?
data.body:
When I drop a nuke on a group of light tanks (CNC), only the one hit directly by the nuke dies. All the ones next to it have barely a scratch.

This contrasts sharply to medium tanks and mammoth tanks, which are all destroyed if they are right next to the center.

data.title: "lost units" in shroud

milestone.title: release-20131223

data.body: Problems with shrouds in Mailander pvfloat playtest. Sniper and rocket men. Then could see them later. Cannot reproduce... album: http://imgur.com/a/jJDwV#0

data.title: Fix floating point inconsistencies to reduce desyncs

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
I had a deep look at pull request #2242 by @JamesDunne as we suspected this introduced problems. It is massive bunch of changes.

My guess is that the change of data types in `Combat.cs` from float2 to new int derivatives is crucial as it effects `Weapon.cs` in one case. I therefore reverted the PVecInt data types of the _Barrel_ functions back, but used the new PVecFloat instead. I think this should make sense. Did not care about everything in the Effects folder. Just modified it to compile again. This commit also removes some conditional compilation left-over junk.

I prepared a test build https://www.dropbox.com/s/5uqpybr1ti210o5/OpenRA-pvecfloat-combat-20130205.zip which is a MonoDevelop compilation with some Windows DLLs so it works out of the box for volunteer testers. We did some quick test games with multiple players, different OS and lot's of units and combat: ~10 games and not a single desync. We have no proper test-case for it, but it should have triggered a sync blame exception when playing excessively. This should fix the common mysterious late-game de-sync-crash introduced in mid 2012 that is hard to reproduce:
- #2607
- #2504
- #2505
- #2478
- #2357
- #2321

It does not fix the reproducible shroud-fog-cheat-missile problem #2661 and the game will crash when neutral has gap generators #2664 so I think those are unrelated.

data.title: [cnc] Obelisk AutoTargeted, airstrike cooldown, +misc.
data.body: Obelisk of light was missing "-AutoTargetIgnore". All the guard towers have it, but for some reason the Obelisk didn't.

data.title: Reproducible desync test case with e3 being attacked with shroud remove cheat in playtest-20130128

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
**Steps to reproduce:**
1. start openra twice
2. create a server
3. join the server with the other client
4. enable all cheats including shroud/fog removal
5. build barracks and train e1 on first instance
6. build barracks and train e3 on second instance
7. attack with e1 the enemy e3

**What happens:**
1. You see the waypoint painted and hear the "acknowledged".
2. Crash Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Out of sync in frame XXX: Blame Tick.

data.title: Starting with damaged silos causes them to display the wrong frame
data.body:
![OpenRA Game_2013_02_04_12_43_17_654](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1712619/124989/a4300ef6-6f05-11e2-96be-9d4a6d224e71.png)

With this YAML:

```
Actor508: silo
    Location: 36,18
    Owner: Neutral
    Health: 0.6
Actor509: silo
    Location: 37,18
    Owner: Neutral
    Health: 0.1
Actor510: silo
    Location: 37,19
    Owner: Neutral
    Health: 0.3
```

data.title: Reproducible DESYNC with Yaks in playtest 20130128
data.body:
We activated cheats and tried some common unit combinations. You can _reproducible_ crash with Yaks against infantry. I (Mono 2.10.9) was hosting and two Win 7 players send units to each other.

Replay: http://dfiles.eu/files/7dh2a4g5m
JOo and me did not hear the yak attack. Only Zypres heart it before the crash.

```
    - JOo
    + Matt

    Sync for net frame 265 -------------
    - SharedRandom: 54266692
    + SharedRandom: 1513708040

    - 91 yak Zypres Health (37)
    + 91 yak Zypres Health (60)
```

Replay: http://dfiles.eu/files/e9g42mp9j
Zypres might have pressed scatter.

```
    - Matt
    + Zypres

    - 59 e3 Zypres Mobile (1400)
    + 59 e3 Zypres Mobile (1473)
```

Hinds did not crash so I think it is because planes are moving while shooting.
